content.description:
Start just left of the huge overhanging chockstone. Climb the thin Flake until the horizontal cracks are reached.  Traverse right and continue up the thin crack. The crux is the final 8 feet of crack where the crack closes up and the feet turn to smears.               

Red - Phantasm Left, orange - Phantasm Right, yellow - Woohoo, Green - WaHoo
content.location: The Yellow route on the Big Face beta photo.

content.description: Climb the outside face of the off-width.  Pull over the bulge onto the top of the massive chock stone. Step right and pull the roof, continue up the center of the face with the use of the horizontal cracks and little to no face holds.  End slightly to the right with the right hand using the vertical side of the upper crack.
content.location:
Below the large protruding chockstone at the offwidth.Green line in the topo.              

Red - Phantasm Left, orange - Phantasm Right, yellow - Woohoo, Green - WaHoo

content.description: "Rope WARNING, very sharp horizontal edge at the big ledge near the left end and the overhanging block"Start standing on top of the two foot tall pointy pyramid shaped boulder.  Climb up on horizontal edges to the horizontal crack and then hand traverse to the right.  Climb up the open book to the big ledge on the right.  Move up the face, above the ledge, on good holds moving toward the center of the face at the top.
content.protection: (Rope WARNING, very sharp horizontal edge at the big ledge near the left end and the overhanging block) Tree Anchor on the opposite side of the Pinnacle.
content.location: About 250ft North East of the Main Wall and the Endurance Block on the Endearing Pinnacle the route is on the tall North facing wall.

content.description:
Although a short climb, this is a fantastic clean overhanging splitter crack. Starts in the corridor near the center of the face.  Climb the inside corner to the large gently sloping ledge.  Follow the lighting bolt splitter crack to the top.  Warning Pump Factor not included in the ratting, this is a beautiful straight forward climb for crack climbers.               

Splitter Endurance shown in yellow.
content.protection: On top the pillar there are several cracks to use for a gear anchor point to toprope the climb from.  With most free standing short pillars to get down, toss the rope down one side of the rock and have someone tie it securely to a tree with 3 wraps around the tree.  Then rappel down the opposite side.  Untie the rope and pull it over and off the pillar.
content.location:
On the overhanging face of the pillar behind the main climbing wall.              

Splitter Endurance shown in yellow.

content.description: There are two cruxes not to be circumnavigated around.  This is the same start as "WooHoo". Climb the thin flake until the horizontal cracks are reached.  Move up to the 2nd horizontal crack and make a dicy long reach up and left for the third horizontal, this is the first crux.  Follow the thin rail up and right to the center of the face.  From the last horizontal make another long reach up and left for a jug just past the left rising edge, this is the second crux.  Finish off by climbing up the face to the right.
content.location: On the Main Wall, just Left of the giant chock stone at thin flakes.

content.description: Lead the obvious jagged crack to the top. Beware there is No anchor on top see Protection below.  It's a fun line, we removed some loose blocks that were sitting around and there might be some more to clean off.  However the rock on the route felt quite solid.
content.protection: There are no anchors on top, not even gear anchors.  The protection is a standard rack.  The top is flat and has a three foot wall.  I'm used to climbing & scrambling around Seneca's many ledge systems, so I felt ok with going off belay.  I pulled up my rope and tied the middle off to my harness.  I untied the end and tossed the rope down the back side of the rock and had someone tie it securely to a tree with 3 wraps around the tree.  Anchoring tightly to the rope, I then top belayed my friends and lowered them off.  And I too rappelled down the climb.  We untied the rope from the tree on the back side of the rock and then pulled the rope down off the pinnacle.
content.location: The South West wall of free standing Pinnacle on the east end of the main outcrop.

content.description: Climb the flake to the horizontal about 8' off the ground.  Move to the right and gain the vertical crack.  When the crack splits follow the Right crack to the top.
content.location:
Directly at the base of the Boulder on the left side of the main wall. Orange Route on the topo.              

Red - Phantasm Left, orange - Phantasm Right, yellow - Woohoo, Green - WaHoo

content.description: Climb the flake to the horizontal about 8' off the ground.  Move to the right and gain the vertical crack.  When the crack splits follow the left crack and you will likely use the right crack for the first couple of moves.
content.protection: The crux is not trivial to protect hence the PG rating.  It took a #4 Black diamond Micro stopper to protect the crux.  below that I had a double 00 Metolius TCU placed in a slightly flaring crack.
content.location:
Directly at the base of the Boulder on the left side of the main wall.Red Route on the topo               

Red - Phantasm Left, orange - Phantasm Right, yellow - Woohoo, Green - WaHoo

content.description: Climb the narrow end of the buttress in Multiple ways. Using the crack and the left or right outer corners.
content.protection: Tree anchor with a long top system running across the top of the outcrop.
content.location: From the left end of the Endurance Block and Main Wall go about 125 feet to the next outcrop, to the North East. The route is on the narrow end of the outcrop at a vertical striking, small hands crack.

content.description: Likely the classic route on the Pinnacle.  Start at the Left outer corner at a short thin vertical crack line that is not really used for the climb.  Climb up the face to the double horizontal cracks and move slightly right, climb into the small and short right facing corner just prior to the ledge. Mount the ledge and move up the flake to the last horizontal hand crack, travers it to the right end.  Layback up a flake then reach around to the corner to the right facing wall for more holds and climb the arete to the top.
content.protection: Tree anchor opposite side of the Pinnacle with a long top system.
content.location: On the Endearing Pinnacle located about 250ft North East of the Main Wall and the Endurance Block the route is on the taller left corner.

content.description:
Down Range Rocks is located South of the police shooting range, high on the top of the hill. It may be down range of the firing line but it is safely out of the line of fire and is quite a ways distant as to not be a danger. The range doesn’t appear to be used very often with months between uses or maintenance. Down Range Rocks has a few rock walls, pinnacles, and numerous large boulders. It is shaded and North Facing.               

Red - Phantasm Left, orange - Phantasm Right, yellow - Woohoo, Green - WaHoo
